int-org-section.heading: Transport

alt-heading.usage: casee sacac ass mena sasia fea eerca
casee sacac ass mena sasia fea eerca

address.verbatim-address: POB 20116, Nairobi 00200, Kenya

org-entry.content-note: aims to give African air cos expert advice in technical, financial, juridical and market matters
to improve air transport in Africa through inter-carrier co-operation
and to develop manpower resources
rotating Presidency (2024: EgyptAir)
publs Newsletter , Africa Skies , reports

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Agency for the Safety of Air Navigation in Africa and Madagascar ASECNA
org-entry-head.alt-name: Agence pour la Sécurité de la Navigation Aérienne en Afrique et Madagascar

address.verbatim-address: 32-38 ave Jean Jaurès, BP 3144, Dakar, Senegal

org-entry.content-note: organizes air-traffic communications in mem. states
co-ordinates meteoro­logical forecasts
provides training for air-traffic controllers, meteoro­logists and airport fire-fighters
ASECNA is under the authority of a cttee comprising ministers of civil aviation of mem. states

mems: Benin, Burkina Faso, Cameroon, Central African Rep., Chad, Comoros, Rep. of the Congo, Côte d'Ivoire, Equatorial Guinea, France, Gabon, Guinea Bissau, Madagascar, Mali, Mauritania, Niger, Senegal, Togo

address.verbatim-address: Bldg 13, Greenstone Hill Office Park, Emerald Blvd, Modderfontein, Johannesburg, South Africa

org-entry.content-note: represents the mutual interests of its regional mems

works together with leaders of the aviation industry and senior public and govt officials on policy, regulatory, planning, operational, safety, security and financial matters affecting the overall profitability of the airlines and their continued sustainability
leads and co-ordinates the airline industry position on airport, airspace and civil aviation issues, as well as consumer legislation, environmental and tourism matters
mems: 15 airlines, 37 assoc.

address.verbatim-address: 6 Rond-Point Schuman, 1040 Brussels, Belgium

org-entry.content-note: promotes the interests of European airlines and their passengers
holds an annual gathering of European airline CEOs

address.verbatim-address: POB 302, 800 rue du Sq. Victoria, Montréal, QC H4Z 1G8, Canada

org-entry.found-date: 1991, following merger of Airport Operators Council International and International Civil Airports Association
org-entry.content-note: aims to represent and enhance co-operation among airports of the world and promote high standards in airport devt and management
supports training progs and an APEX peer review scheme
organizes an annual General Assembly, Conference and Exhibition
org-entry.stats: mems: 757 mems operating over 2,109 airports in 191 countries and territories
org-entry.content-note: publs ACI World Newsletter , Annual Report , ACI Insights (blog), regular technical papers and reports on safety, security, IT, customer experience

address.verbatim-address: Beirut Harbor, 1504 Bldg, George Haddad St, Saifi, 1107 2020 Beirut, Lebanon

org-entry.content-note: promotes ­co-operation in the activities of Arab airline cos
publs bulletins, reports and research documents

address.verbatim-address: 4 Ptolemy St, Alexandria, Egypt

org-entry.found-date: 1976 under the auspices of the Council of Arab Economic Unity

address.verbatim-address: Menara Max, 36th Floor, 50450 Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

org-entry.found-date: 1966 as Orient Airlines Asscn, present name adopted in 1997
org-entry.content-note: represents the interests of the region’s airlines and provides a forum for all mems to exchange information and views on matters of common concern
maintains representation in Brussels, Belgium, and in Washington, DC, USA
publs Annual Report , Annual Statistical Report , AAPA Monthly International Statistics (MIS)

address.verbatim-address: Bags­vaerdvej 161, 2880 Bagsvaerd, Denmark

org-entry.content-note: connects shipowners and other industry-related bodies
aims to facilitate commercial operations by sharing information and training resources and to establish sound business practices
publ. BIMCO Bulletin (6 a year)

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Central Commission for the Navigation of the Rhine

address.verbatim-address: Palais du Rhin, 2 pl. de la République, CS10023, 67082 Strasbourg, France

org-entry.found-date: 1815 to ensure free movement of traffic and standard river facilities for ships of all nations
org-entry.content-note: responsible for drawing up Rhine regulations
its work is guided by the efficiency of transport on the Rhine, safety, social considerations, and respect for the environment
many CCNR activities also extend beyond the Rhine and are directly concerned more generally with European navigable waterways
mems: Belgium, France, Germany, Netherlands, Switzerland
publs guides, rules and directives (in French, German and Dutch)

address.verbatim-address: Benczúr utca 25, 1068 Budapest, Hungary

org-entry.content-note: oversees implementation of the Belgrade Convention on the Regime of Navigation on the Danube
approves projects for river maintenance
supervises a uniform system of traffic regulations on the whole navigable portion of the Danube and on river inspection
mems: Austria, Bulgaria, Croatia, Germany, Hungary, Moldova, Romania, Russian Fed. (suspended in March 2022), Serbia, Slovakia, Ukraine
publs Basic Rules of Navigation on the Danube , Hydrological Yearbook , Statistical Yearbook , proceed­ings of ­sessions

address.verbatim-address: 3 bis Villa Emile-Bergerat, 92522 Neuilly-sur-Seine Cedex, France

org-entry.content-note: aims to promote the continued devt of a safe, efficient and sustainable European air transport system

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: European Organisation for the Safety of Air Navigation (EUROCONTROL)

address.verbatim-address: 96 rue de la Fusée, 1130 Brussels, Belgium

org-entry.content-note: aims to develop a seamless, pan-European air traffic management (ATM) system that fully copes with the growth in air traffic, while maintaining a high level of safety, reducing costs and respecting the environment

there are directorates, covering human resources and finance matters, and a general secretariat; a special organizational structure covers the management of the European Air Traffic Management Programme

operates the Experi­mental Centre (at Brétigny-sur-Orge, France), the Institute of Air Navigation Services (in Luxembourg), the Central Route Charges Office, the Central Flow Management Unit (both in Brussels) and the Upper Area Control Centre (in Maastricht, Netherlands)
EUROCONTROL signed Comprehensive Agreements with Morocco and Israel in 2016
publ. Skyway (2 a year)

address.verbatim-address: Hilfikerstr. 3, 3000 Bern 65, Switzerland

org-entry.found-date: 1923 as the European Passenger Train Time-Table Conference
org-entry.content-note: promotes cross border co-operation and facilitates international passenger connections and (since 1997) rail freight transport
mems: about 100

address.verbatim-address: BP 90093, 59559 Comines Cedex, France

org-entry.content-note: promotes the use, conservation and devt of inland waterways worldwide

hosts the steering cttee to choose the venue of the annual World Canals Conference (2024: Bydgoszcz, Poland, in
June)
org-entry.stats: mems: waterway authorities, operators, 1 int. org., other orgs and individuals in 20 countries

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Intergovernmental Organization for International Carriage by Rail

address.verbatim-address: Gryphen­hübeliweg 30, 3006 Bern, Switzerland

org-entry.found-date: 1893 as Central Office for International Carriage by Rail, present name adopted in 1985
org-entry.content-note: aims to establish and develop a uniform system of law governing the international carriage of passengers and goods by rail in mem. states, and to facilitate its application and devt
composed of a General Assembly, an Administrative Cttee, a Revision Cttee, a Cttee of Experts on the Transport of Dangerous Goods, a Cttee of Technical Experts and a Rail Facilitation Cttee
org-entry.stats: mems: 50 states in Europe, Asia and North Africa; 1 assoc. mem.
org-entry.content-note: publs Annual Report , Bulletin des transports internationaux ferroviaires (quarterly, in English, French and German)

address.verbatim-address: 800 pl. Victoria, POB 113, Montréal, QC H4Z 1M1, Canada

org-entry.content-note: aims to promote the sustainable growth of the airline industry, as well as ensuring safe, efficient travel for consumers
its principal progs cover cargo; distribution, payments and taxation; passenger experience and policy; aviation sustainability; operations and infrastructure; security; safety; and an Innovation Hub
in June 2019 published with the ICAO , published a Manual on the Legal Aspects of Unruly and Disruptive Passengers

at the onset of the COVID-19 emergency in March 2020 urged govts to support airlines and to recognize the importance of the industry for future economic recovery; administered an online COVID-19 Dashboard on State and Airport Restrictions
in 2021 launched a digital IATA Travel Pass

maintains an executive office in Geneva, Switzerland; and regional offices in Amman, Jordan; Beijing, People’s Rep. of China; Brussels, Belgium; Johannesburg, South Africa; Madrid, Spain; Miami, USA; Moscow, Russia; Singapore; and Washington, DC, USA
holds an annual general meeting and World Air Transport Summit (WATS): 2024, to be hosted by Emirates, in Dubai, United Arab Emirates, in June
publs Airlines (every 2 months), Annual Review , industry standards, guidelines, factsheets and manuals

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Association of Ports and Harbors

address.verbatim-address: New Pier Takeshiba South Tower, 7th Floor, 1-16-1, Kaigan, Minato-ku, Tokyo 105-0022, Japan

org-entry.content-note: aims to increase the efficiency of ports and harbours and the growth of waterborne commerce
researches and disseminates studies concerning climate and energy, data collaboration, and risk and resilience
holds an annual conf. (2023: Abu Dhabi, UAE, in Oct.-Nov.)
org-entry.stats: mems: 168 ports and 134 port-related businesses in 84 states
org-entry.content-note: publs Ports and Harbors (6 a year), Membership Directory (annually)

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Bridge, Tunnel and Turnpike Association

address.verbatim-address: 2021 L St, NW, Suite 100-343, Washington, DC 20036-3725, USA

org-entry.content-note: serves as a forum for sharing knowledge, with the aim of promoting toll-financed transportation services
publs IBTTA SmartBrief Daily , annual and thematic reports

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Bureau of Containers and Intermodal Transport
org-entry-head.alt-name: Bureau international des containers et du transport intermodal—BIC

address.verbatim-address: 41 rue Réaumur, 75003 Paris, France

org-entry.found-date: 1933 as Bureau International des Containers by the International Chamber of Commerce , present name adopted in 1948 on the assumption of intermodal activities
org-entry.content-note: aims to bring together representatives of all means of transport and activities concerning containers, to promote combined door-to-door transport by the successive use of several means of transport, to examine and bring into effect advances in administrative, technical and customs practice, and to centralize data on behalf of mems
publs BIC News , Containers (quarterly), Containers Bic-Code (annually)

address.verbatim-address: 38 St Mary Axe, London, EC3A 8BH, United Kingdom

org-entry.content-note: aims to co-ordinate the views of the international shipping industry on matters of common interest, in the policymaking, technical and legal fields of shipping operations
incorporates the International Shipping Federation (f. 1909) which represents maritime employers
holds an annual general meeting
org-entry.stats: mems: nat. asscns representing free enterprise ship­owners and operators in 35 countries, representing about 80% of the world merchant fleet
org-entry.content-note: publs Annual Review , Shipping Industry Flag State Performance Table (annually)

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Federation of Freight Forwarders Associations

address.verbatim-address: 6 rue Kléberg, 1201 Geneva, Switzerland

org-entry.content-note: represents the freight forwarding industry at international level
holds an annual World Congress (2023: Brussels, Belgium, in Oct.)
est. in Feb. 2022, with the International Chamber of Commerce and other partners, a new Future International Trade Alliance, with a focus on developing new standards to facilitate electronic trade
org-entry.stats: mems: 40,000 forwarding and logistics firms in 150 countries
org-entry.content-note: publs FIATA Review (every 2 months), Annual Report

address.verbatim-address: Weltpoststr. 20, 3015 Bern, Switzerland

org-entry.content-note: supports the devt of international law relating to railway transport, on the basis of the Convention concerning International Carriage by Rail and its Appendices
may adopt standard rules on other questions relating to international transport law
publ. CIT News

address.verbatim-address: Madison Pl., 500 Montgomery St, Alexandria, VA, USA

org-entry.content-note: aims to encourage the devt and improvement of highways and highway transportation
organizes IRF world and regional meetings
awards educational scholarships and Global Road Achievement Awards
org-entry.stats: mems: 80 nat. road asscns and 500 individual firms and industrial asscns
org-entry.content-note: publs IRF Examiner , IRF White Papers , statistical, technical and scientific reports

address.verbatim-address: ave Alaraar, Hay Riyaad, 10000 Rabat, Morocco

org-entry.content-note: works to exchange ideas and material on road safety, education, campaigns and advocacy
organizes international action and congresses

address.verbatim-address: 16 chemin de la Voie-Creuse, 1211 Geneva 20, Switzerland

org-entry.content-note: represents, promotes and upholds the interests of the road transport industry at international level, working to harmonize regulations relating to road transport and enhance its use for passengers and goods
org-entry.stats: mems: 175 asscns and assoc. mems in 80 countries

address.verbatim-address: 29/II Kneza Branimira, 10000 Zagreb, Croatia

org-entry.found-date: 2005 to implement the Framework Agreement on the Sava River Basin (FASRB)
org-entry.content-note: also mandated to establish an international regime of navigation on the Sava River and its navigable tributaries; to implement sustainable water management; and to undertake measures to prevent or limit hazards, such as floods, ice, droughts and accidents involving substances hazardous to water
63rd session: June 2023, in Zagreb (a follow-up meeting was held in Sept.)
chaired, on a rotating basis, for a 3-year term, by participating mems (2023-26: Serbia)
org-entry.stats: mems: Bosnia and Herzegovina, Croatia, Serbia, Slovenia
org-entry.content-note: publ. SAVA News Flash

address.verbatim-address: 2 rue André Pascal, 75775 Paris Cedex 16, France

org-entry.found-date: 2006 by a decision of the European Conference of Ministers of Transport (f. 1953) to broaden membership
org-entry.content-note: aims to create a safe, sustainable, efficient, integrated transport system
hosts an annual Forum in May, in Leipzig, Germany
organizes roundtable discussions, seminars and working group meetings
publs Annual Report , various statistical publs and surveys

address.verbatim-address: 2 rue André Pascal, 75775 Paris Cedex 16, France

org-entry.found-date: 2006 by a decision of the European Conference of Ministers of Transport (f. 1953) to broaden membership
org-entry.content-note: aims to create a safe, sustainable, efficient, integrated transport system
hosts an annual Forum in Liepzig, Germany, in May
organizes roundtable discussions, seminars and working group meetings
in May 2018 concluded an MoU with the World Bank and the International Automobile Federation to establish the first regional Road Safety Observatory in Africa
publs Annual Report , various statistical publs and surveys

org-entry-head.alt-name: Union internationale des chemins de fer—UIC

address.verbatim-address: 16 rue Jean-Rey, 75015 Paris, France

org-entry.content-note: aims to ensure international interoperability of the rail system
compiles information on economic, management and technical aspects of railways
co-ordinates research and collaborates with industry and the European Union
organizes international confs
publs technical documents, catalogues, information database

address.verbatim-address: Vasteland 78, Rotterdam, Netherlands

org-entry.found-date: 1874 by German and Swiss insurance cos, as the Rheinschiffsregisterverband, in order to register inland navigation vessels; re-established in 1947, as the Int. Asscn for the Rhine Ships Register (Internationale Vereniging het Rijnschepenregister—IVR) as a broader org. to undertake the classification of vessels, as well as the unification of general average rules and the maintenance of European inland navigation law; present name adopted in 2001 with an expansion in European membership
org-entry.content-note: provides a platform for experts in the field of shipping, insurance, maritime affairs and related sectors, and representatives of national govts
has developed an Engine Registration System, a damage prevention inspection programme, and maintains an online inland navigation vessels database
org-entry.stats: mems: 15 countries and the European Barge Union, 3 assoc. mems

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Latin American and Caribbean Air Transport Association
org-entry-head.alt-name: Asociación Latinoamericana y del Caribe de Transporte Aéreo—ALTA

address.verbatim-address: Bella Vista, Calle 43 Este, Of. 6 g , Panama

org-entry.content-note: aims to co-ordinate and facilitate the efforts of mems to develop the region’s airline industry
specialized cttees include safety, fraud prevention, environment, aviation charges and fuel
org-entry.stats: mems: 34 airlines, 16 assoc. and 59 affiliate mems

address.verbatim-address: Hozà 63/67, 00681 Warsaw, Poland

org-entry.content-note: promotes co-operation on issues relating to traffic policy and economic and environmental aspects of railway traffic
ensures enforcement of a number of rail agreements
aims to elaborate and standard­ize general principles for international transport law
Conference of Mins of mem. countries meets annually, Conference of General Dirs of Railways meets at least once a year
org-entry.stats: mems: ministries of transport of 29 countries worldwide, and 6 observers and 39 assoc. mems
org-entry.content-note: publs OSJD Bulletin (every 2 months, in Chinese, English and Russian), OSJD Bulletin of Statistic Data on Railway Transport (annually)

org-entry-head.alt-name: Asociación del Congreso Panamericano de Ferrocarriles

address.verbatim-address: Avda Dr José María Ramos Mejía 1302, Planta Baja, 1104 Buenos Aires, Argentina

org-entry.content-note: aims to promote the devt and progress of railways in the American continent
permanent technical consultative body of the OAS
org-entry.stats: mems: govt representatives, railway enterprises and individuals in 17 countries

org-entry-head.alt-name: World Association for Waterborne Transport Infrastructure

address.verbatim-address: Bãt Graaf de Ferraris, 11e étage, 20 blvd Roi Albert II, bte 3, 1000 Brussels, Belgium

org-entry.found-date: 1885 as Permanent International Association of Navigation Congresses
org-entry.content-note: fosters progress in the construction, maintenance and operation of inland and maritime waterways, of inland and maritime ports and of coastal areas
holds World Congress every 4 years (2024: Cape Town, South Africa), and other regional and sectoral confs
org-entry.stats: mems: 44 nat. sections, as well as 500 corp. and 1,800 individual mems in 66 countries
org-entry.content-note: publs PIANC Yearbook , Sailing Ahead (electronic newsletter), technical reports, Congress papers

address.verbatim-address: 6 rue Sainte-Marie, 1080 Brussels, Belgium

org-entry.content-note: serves as an international network for public transport authorities, operators, policymakers, industry reps and scientific institutes
promotes sustainable urban transport options
organizes a regular Global Public Transport Summit (2025: Hamburg, Germany, in June)

address.verbatim-address: 221 ave Louise, bte 11, 1050 Brussels, Belgium

org-entry.content-note: represents cos concerned with the design, manufacture and maintenance of railway systems and equipment
publs Annual Report , technical reports, position papers

address.verbatim-address: c/o IATA, 800 Pl. Victoria, POB 113, Montréal, QC H4Z 1M1, Canada

org-entry.content-note: holds a General Assembly annually, regional meetings, social progs, international events and sports tournaments

address.verbatim-address: La Grande Arche, Paroi Sud, 5e étage, 92055 La Défense Cedex, France

org-entry.found-date: 1909 as the Permanent International Association of Road Congresses
org-entry.content-note: aims to promote the construction, improvement, maintenance, use and economic devt of roads
organizes technical cttee and study sessions
World Congress held every 4 years (2023: Prague, Czech Rep., in Oct.)
org-entry.stats: mems: 127 govts; public bodies, orgs and private individuals in 142 countries
org-entry.content-note: publs Bulletin , Technical Dictionary , Lexicon , technical reports
